message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CV, cs.MM, cs.DB, cs.CL. 

The paper describes an end-to-end content-based image retrieval system built upon Elasticsearch, a well-known and popular textual search engine. The system utilizes Elasticsearch to efficiently retrieve similar images based on similarities within encoded string tokens. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.IR (Information Retrieval). However, the paper also extensively addresses first-hand experiences in implementing this Elasticsearch-based platform, which could fall under cs.DB (Databases). Additionally, the paper deals with image feature vectors and encoding methods, which could be categorized under cs.CV (Computer Vision) and cs.MM (Multimedia). Finally, the paper discusses the flexibility of the platform in supporting multimodal searches, which could be related to cs.CL (Computation and Language).
